discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
GET VPN ensures that traffic is always encrypted.

questions.question_text:
A company requires a private WAN design that allows remote sites to connect to HQ. The design must ensure that:

• traffic is always encrypted
• forwarding overhead is reduced
• management of security is centralized
• multicast traffic is supported

Which technology must the company select?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Multicast Support:
GET VPN includes features like "Multicast Rekeying" to enable encryption for "native" multicast packets, and unicast rekeying. 
Key Server:
The configuration that defines which traffic to encrypt originates from the key server, allowing for centralized control and flexibility.

questions.question_text: An architect is designing how the company will manage the infrastructure of a large data center. The company wants to group device types for security reasons and mitigate DoS attacks. The company also wants to ensure that access to the rest of the production network is not possible if one device is compromised on the management plane. Which solution must the architect choose?

A customer is undergoing a WAN re-architecture and wants to design QoS policies for remote sites that have low bandwidth. What must be considered to have CBWFQ configured in the parent and child policies in an end-to-end QoS design?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It is recommended that child policies use such traffic control (policing) as appropriate.This will prevent excessive bandwidth usage that may occur at remote sites.

choices.A: Traffic policing is required in the child policy.
choices.B: CBWFQ is only supported in the child policy.
choices.C: CBWFQ is only supported in the parent policy.
choices.D: Traffic shaping is required in the parent policy.

questions.question_text: When is it advisable to provide dedicated control plane nodes within a Cisco SD-Access design?

choices.D: in a design where fabric edge nodes are unable to provide control plane functionality
choices.A: in a small deployment where border nodes are not required
choices.B: when there is a requirement for frequent roaming of endpoints across fabric edge nodes
choices.C: in designs without Cisco DNA Center

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is:

B. when there is a requirement for frequent roaming of endpoints across fabric edge nodes

Explanation:

In Cisco SD-Access, dedicated control plane nodes are recommended when there is a need for scalability and to support features like frequent roaming of endpoints. This ensures that the control plane can manage the mapping database efficiently, avoiding potential performance issues that might arise if control plane functionality were distributed across fabric edge nodes.

Option D (in a design where fabric edge nodes are unable to provide control plane functionality) could also seem relevant, but the best answer for scalability and optimal performance, especially for endpoint mobility, is B.

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B after reading Swiz005 source

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B
Source - https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/Campus/cisco-sda-design-guide.html#:~:text=One%20other%20consideration,should%20be%20used.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An architect must design a solution to connect the two ASs. To optimize bandwidth, the design will implement load sharing between router R6 and router R1. Which solution should the design include?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Use maximum-paths to install multiple paths in the routing table: This configuration allows multiple paths to be installed in the routing table for the same destination prefix, enabling load sharing between R1 and R6. By using the maximum-paths command, traffic can be load balanced between the two routers, optimizing bandwidth utilization.

comments.content: It is only 1 eBGP hop for both paths

discussion.content:
C is the correct answare. R6 wants two bgp sessio to R1, one of direct other is not. Therefore second session is not able to succes becouse of BGP ttl=1. You have to setting ebgp-multihop .
https://networklessons.com/bgp/ebgp-multihop

Selected Answer: D
Provided answer is correct

choices.D: Use maximum-paths to install multiple paths in the routing table.
choices.C: Configure the eBGP TTL to support eBGP multihop.
choices.A: Use update-source to specify the Loopback interface.
choices.B: Use next-hop-self attributes only for routes that are learned from eBGP peers.
